item.title: Australia just witnessed its first mass shooting on social media. Here's how major platforms are handling it
item.description: <p>H﻿ere&#x27;s how some of the major social media platforms are handling the fallout.</p>

item.title: Selfless acts show that light will overcome the darkness
item.description: <p>When trying to comprehend the enormity of the horror unleashed in the terror attack at Bondi Beach, it&#x27;s the smaller details - the little things - that catch me in my tracks, Deborah Knight writes.</p>

item.title: Body found in search for missing fisherman off South Australia's coast
item.description: <p>The body of a fisherman who went missing off Cape Jaffa in South Australia has been recovered.</p>

item.title: Sydney barber denies gang-raping teen for six hours in her car
item.description: <p>Adam Abdul-Hamid pleaded not guilty to two of the charges against him.</p>

item.title: Trump calls for 'love and prayers' for victims of Bondi Beach terror attack
item.description: <p>US President Donald Trump has sent his &quot;love and prayers&quot; to Australia as the nation reels in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.</p>

item.title: There are over 1.1 million legal guns in NSW. New laws in the wake of the Bondi attack could drastically shrin
item.description: <p>Sajid Akram was among 254,992 registered gun owners in NSW as of July 2025, a figure which excludes collectors and dealers.</p>

item.title: Jewish bakery forced to shutter after Bondi shooting and years of 'ceaseless antisemitic harassment'
item.description: <p>T﻿he Sydney store, owned by former TV chef Ed Halmagyi, was closed up tight this morning.</p>

item.title: Girl, Holocaust survivor, former police officer: What we know about the 15 people killed in the Bondi Beach te
item.description: <p>A Soviet immigrant and loving father, Boris Tetleroyd was killed during the Bondi shooting.</p>

item.title: 'Just doing his job': Officer seriously injured in Bondi Beach attack praised for his bravery under fire
item.description: <p>T﻿he family of a probationary constable who was wounded as he responded to Sunday&#x27;s mass shooting have issued a statement.</p>

item.title: Man arrested after 27-year-old dies following serious assault
item.description: <p>Emergency services were called to reports of an alleged serious assault at a home in Warrigal Road in Cheltenham just before 10pm. </p>

item.title: Farmer killed by falling tree during bushfire in Western Australia
item.description: <p>The 34-year-old was a part of the local farmer response unit and had been assisting firefighters responding to a large bushfire.</p>

item.title: Reality star accused of killing partner awaits evidence
item.description: <p>Tamika Chesser was charged with murder, destroying human remains and perverting the course of justice.</p>

item.title: Accused CBD stabber gets bail, but won't be released
item.description: <p>An accused stabber who allegedly attacked a worker on a city footpath has been granted bail - but won&#x27;t be released into the community.</p>

item.title: First major New Year's Eve event planned for Bondi in more than a decade cancelled after terror attack
item.description: <p>New Year&#x27;s Eve events at Bondi Beach have been officially cancelled in the wake of Sunday&#x27;s terror attack.﻿</p>

item.title: Emotional moment crowd sings 'I am Australian' at Bondi Beach vigil
item.description: <p>T﻿he young man said he was quite nervous to sing but wanted to do something that showed the Jewish community they deserve to be safe in Australia.</p>

item.title: Riot police swarm Melbourne beach after youths storm supermarket, throw items at officers
item.description: <p>Riot police have swarmed a Melbourne beach after hundreds of youths stormed a nearby supermarket this afternoon.</p>

item.title: Alleged Bondi gunman charged with 59 offences including 15 counts of murder
item.description: <p>Naveed, 24, was injured in the terrorist attack and had been﻿ in a coma while recovering in hospital until yesterday.</p>

item.title: Josh Frydenberg doubles down on criticism of prime minister over Bondi terror attack
item.description: <p>Josh Frydenberg re-iterated he holds Anthony Albanese accountable for the Bondi terror attack during a TV appearance and claims the leader knew &quot;stronger action&quot; was needed ahead of the shooting.</p>

item.title: 'Our nation is stronger than the cowards who seek to divide us': PM says

item.title: 'Torn away from the ones he loved so dearly': Mourners farewell first victims of Bondi Beach terror attack
item.description: <p>Normally there are no eulogies at a Jewish funeral, just prayers. But tradition was pushed aside, so the world would know what it has lost. </p>
